tr.td: Title:The Universe at z>7: z-drops in the Ultra Deep Field
Co-I(s): Elizabeth Stanway, Richard McMahon, David Crampton, Karl Glazebrook, Warrick Couch, Patrick McCarthy, Isobel Hook, Roberto Abraham, The GLARE Consortium

body.div: In preliminary work with Gemini (the ongoing GLARE project) we have spectroscopically confirmed the existence of sample of galaxies at z=6. This proposal aims to obtain the first spectra of unlensed galaxies at redshifts 7<z<10. This redshift range represents a totally unexplored transition epoch in the history of the Universe, between the onset of Gunn-Peterson absorption by HI at z~6.2 and a predominantly neutral Universe at z>10. Our observations will probe both the first sources of reionizing radiation in the Universe and the very first phases of galaxy formation at the end of the cosmic dark age.
